intro: Tetrapterys catarinensis, commonly known as the Catarinensis sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. Tetrapterys catarinensis is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal or dune environments.
